reviews.text: A four star hotel near Munich Auptbahnhof, 13 minutes from the Oktoberfest site (if you've a jetpack presumably), seemed ideal. Can't complain about the location or the cleanliness of the hotel, and the staff were friendly and courteous - but this is never four star; there are too many basics that are not available. My room was decorated like a corridor; it had no aircon or ironing facilities; the wardrobe amounted to a bar with coat-hangers above the television; there was no stationary or proper drawers for clothes. On the day I left, I had to keep the room until my check-out time (12.00) because there was no concierge service - the only hotel I've ever known not to have some kind of room to keep your cases. When I got back to my room at 11.30, my card no longer opened the door - I had to go back to the reception to ask to retrieve my case. The hotel is serviced by two tiny lifts, so there's a lot of waiting around. And finally, it's almost impossible to get coffee or orange juice at breakfast after 9.00.
reviews.title: Two star at best

reviews.text: All individually minor faults, as a combination not something to mar my trip. But it's certainly nothing like a four-star hotel. Two-star at best.
reviews.title: "GREAT"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Regent for 5 nights with my son. Perfect location, great value for money. Couldnt fault anything!!!!
reviews.title: Decent room, but no aircon - very noisy from street below!!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It was very humid and warm during our stay and we had to sleep witht he windows open as the room had no aircon. Friday and Saturday of our trip we hardly slept at all.... the heat and the noise from the street below woke me 3 or 4 times. People shouting, cars revving their engines, police cars, the works... avoid this hotel if its at all warm and you like to sleep!! The room itself was spacious, bed comfortable although not a double as we had asked for, bathroom very nice (except that the one basin kept blocking up)... so not bad overall. But for a 4 star hotel to not have aircon in a country where the summers do get pretty warm is not great... especially on busy road where you know revellers are going to be stumbling home 2 or 3 am after a night out drinking... Also, during our stay we were not once asked by the staff if everything was ok.
reviews.title: Convenient location but specify the room you want!

reviews.text: Great location as it is right by the train station. The rooms vary greatly, initially we were given a PINK room which was terrible, and friends had a much nicer room, like the photos on the site, be specific and make sure you get the best room on offer. Breakfast was very good! The neighbourhood is fine, despite some reviews suggesting otherwise. Reasonable for what you pay....
reviews.title: Could go either way...

reviews.text: The Regent in Munich was one of the few centrally located choices left due to a trade fair and in the aftermath of Octoberfest. Hence the pricing for the room was pretty steep with EUR 160, especially considering what this hotel offers.
reviews.title: Disappointing and too expensive

reviews.text: The hotel is located near the main train station in a very convenient location for public transport. There is a supermarket right across the street, but the overall all area is a bit train station like, meaning not the greatest area to walk around in.
reviews.title: Comfortable clean and characterless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby area has a worn and a bit outdated feel to it, the check-in staff was moderately friendly and efficient. The rooms have been rennovated in the recent years and follow a modern, but cheap looking, design. The overall impression of the room was that is was worn and cleanliness was also not very impressive. If you have a room to the main street it is also not possible to have the window open when sleeping.
reviews.title: Location Location Location Comfortable Convenient

reviews.text: WiFi is offered, and though I did not have to use it, my neighbour apparently had to sit out in the hallway to have proper reception.
reviews.title: A hostel not a hotel

reviews.text: The beds were very good though, but did not justify the price I paid. I am sure if you stay at the regular rates this hotel offers, the value is fine. This is definitely a no frills basic place to stay in Munich, which has a youth hostel feel to it. Generally not what a business traveller is looking for.
reviews.title: Good enough for a short stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed to fly out of MUC very early, so spent the night at the Airport RegentPark Hotel in Hallbergmoos, near MUC. A park and fly hotel that caters to travelers, even to having continental breakfast that begins at 3 AM! Very nice stay, helpful staff, great shuttle service to hotel and delightful restaurant on premises. It's located in a small town, and we took a very nice stroll before we had dinner. Quiet evening of sleep, prompt shuttle to airport, good price. Highly recommend this hotel to air travelers.
reviews.title: Confusion of reviews between different Regent Hotels in Munich!

reviews.text: NOTE: I see that in the reviews it has been confused with a Regent Hotel in the city of Munich near the train station. That property has some negative reviews and should not be confused with this hotel!! See http://www.airport-hotel-regent.com/ for more info on this airport hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel - great location - lovely staff

reviews.text: Having read the last review on this hotel, I wasn't expecting too much. Much to our surprise, my family and I had a lovely stay at the Regent. It wasn't the newest of hotels, but the rooms were very clean, the linen crisp, the staff exceptionally helpful and friendly and the morning breakfasts (7am - 10.30am) not lacking in refills. What made it a good family hotel is its location. When you've spent a day out sightseeing, you appreciate a hotel that's literally about 30-40meters from the 'Main' Hauptbahnhof station. It's about a 20 minute walk to the Marienplatz. If you take a taxi to the Marienplatz its 10 Euros. The hop-on, hop-off buses (18 Euros pp) were just a 10 minute walk away from the hotel. Note that there are about a dozen hotels all along the Arnulfstrasse area - some look nicer than others. In retrospect, we have absolutely no regrets staying at the Regent and would do so again. One thing though - the lifts will only allow 3 people and a bag at a time. If you can live with that, it;s a good place to stay.
reviews.title: Obviously going downhill

reviews.text: We booked the Regent for a weekend break, partly because of its location and partly because of its good reviews . However, we failed to see how it could possibly rate 4 stars or how it had got such good reviews - perhaps things used to be better? Our biggest gripe was the fact that the heating in our room was stuck on full 24 hours a day, so we were sweltering even with the windows wide open - and bearing in mind it was well below 0 degrees at night outside. We asked this to be rectified but nothing happened. To be fair the 2 broken lightbulbs in our companions' room were quickly replaced, but they should really have been checked when preparing the room. The general malaise was reflected in the albeit trivial fact that the breakfast toaster was only 1/2 working throughout our visit, a source of no apparent concern to the staff - rather than a reason to buy another one or get it repaired quickly. Excellent location, and reasonably priced, and I'm sure there are worse - but wouldn't recommend.
reviews.title: Unadequate Web Presentation

reviews.text: The web presentation of Regent hotel and the reality are very different. The lobby, the bar and the rooms are of the much lower quality in comparison to photos! I cannot understand why there are four stars, it is 2.5 stars hotel and nothing else. No any room equipment necessary for 4*, evenmore no other equipments, for example - If you ask for the whiskey or cola with ice in the bar, the answer is that ice arrives on mondays and (since it was friday) no ice for the next three days?!? Etc...
reviews.title: average , but good value

reviews.text: We were very satisfied with this hotel. It was close to the airport and the shuttle bus was very cheap.We only paid 6 Euros for a night transfer at 04:30am. Although it was close to the airport, we did not hear much of the air traffic.
reviews.title: Very good Hotel close to the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitly visit this hotel again in the future when I am in Munich.
reviews.title: Convenient, clean, friendly, but a bit tired around the edges....

reviews.text: Only 200m from the main train station, but tucked away from any noise, clean rooms with nice shower rooms, good breakfast room but same fayre every day. cramped lifts :( nice little cocktail bar, try and get the barman to make it happy hour all night :)
reviews.title: Website very misleading

reviews.text: For only 80 euros per night B&B for 2 people, its a good deal for a city break in Europe :)
reviews.title: The hotel website is misleading
Expensive and bad service
reviews.text: From the website this hotel seems like a lovely place to stay. They must have got a great photographer to do justice to this hotel! Wouldn't stay here again - beds were hard, bathrooms were horrible, furniture old and cheap lino on floors buckling, remote control on TV broken, only soap and tissues in bathroom and none of the special 'touches' of a good hotel. Staff were reasonably friendly and efficient. Maybe I expect too much from hotels and in Munich in summer I think you need to pay for what you get but I wouldn't stay here again.
